(Well, it's not like that one was that hard there Cyber.)

Ice::

She noticed the bear appeared nervous. She stepped back from the bear 
and kept walking on. She stopped and looked back at the bear. She 
msiled, "Yeah,your a noble animal. And thank you for your 
generosity."  SHe smiled at the bear then continued on.
Leaving the bear behind. 

She felt her shoulder throbbing and hurting even more. She was 
starting to have trouble walking.  She kept going and went over the 
hill.  She stumbled and rolled down the hill. She landed on her chin 
and cut her lip on one of her teeth. She stood up and cursed under 
her breath. Her shoulder was still dripping red liquid and now her 
lip had a small cut.  She tasted the fluid and grimiced. "Ick, Oh 
that stuff tasted horrible." 

She walked a little further until she shoulder hurt so badly she 
didn't want to take another step. She layed down in the snow and 
breathed heavily.  The pain was getting worse, and she was starting 
to get hungry, very hungry.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
The bear drew closer and smelled the stranger. It didn't know why or 
> how it had the same scent but it knew the twin wasn't appearing 
> threatening. It's twin was a bit larger than her but it wasn't 
> fealing threatened. It nuzzled against Ice smelling the bandages on 
> her back. It stepped back slightly, then moved back again. The 
female 
> bear sensed an oddity about it's twin, something that didn't 
belong. 
> It was getting fearful and a bit nervous.
>
